poem:
Title: "Innocence Caught Between Alliances of Pain"

Torn pages of time murmur of Noa,
In a blur of unwelcome truths, under duress afloat.
Bitterly claimed by crossfire, oranges of war,
Two lives lost in the mistrust's mote.
Somewhere, video reels waltz across borders,
Narrating a tale, silent as a ghost.
Oh, mankind's what-if's, deafening in silent whispers,
On the crumpled lap of peace, hostages were the host.
